title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description:
An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected. 

To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:

1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type 'DateTime'.
3. In the 'Default Value' field, enter an invalid date string, for example, '55/66/9999'.

Observed Behavior:

The invalid value is accepted, and the report design shows the following definition for the parameter:

<parameters>
  <scalarparameter name="dateParam1">
    <property name="dataType">dateTime</property>
    <property name="allowBlank">false</property>
    <property name="format">Unformatted</property>
    <property name="controlType">textbox</property>
    <expression name="defaultValue">55/66/9999</expression>
  </scalarparameter>
</parameters>

Expected Behavior:

1. The model should store a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss) instead of the invalid value entered, to ensure portability.

2. The date value should be validated by the UI or model to prevent the acceptance of invalid dates.
OB: The invalid date value '55/66/9999' is accepted when entered as the default value for a 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer.
EB: The BIRT report designer should reject invalid date values, such as '55/66/9999', when entered as the default value for a 'DateTime' type report parameter.
SR:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type 'DateTime'.
3. In the 'Default Value' field, enter an invalid date string, for example, '55/66/9999'.
4. Verify that the invalid value is rejected and an appropriate error message is displayed.
